Legal_Issue: Personal liability of director for trademark infringement
Governing_Law: Common law principles on personal liability of directors in intellectual property infringement
Evidence_Assessment: Mr. Kichuk conducted a trademark search, had no prior knowledge of 'ISO-FLEX', and made inquiries after receiving a cease and desist letter; plaintiffs provided no contradictory evidence
Burden_of_Proof: Plaintiffs failed to meet burden of showing genuine issue of material fact
Credibility_Factor: No evidence undermining Mr. Kichuk's assertions was presented
Legal_Rule: Directors and officers are personally liable if they deliberately, willfully, and knowingly pursue conduct likely to infringe or show indifference to the risk of infringement
Standard_of_Review: Summary judgment standard â€“ whether a genuine issue for trial exists
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged deliberate actions by Mr. Kichuk leading to trademark infringement
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed against Mr. Kichuk and Mr. Glover
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Summary judgment granted in favor of defendants
Review_Standard: De novo review of legal standards, factual disputes assessed for materiality
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Defendant given opportunity to respond; plaintiffs failed to produce counterevidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Trademark search conducted by Mr. Kichuk, lack of prior knowledge, post-notice inquiries
Legal_Framework: Intellectual property law, corporate officer liability doctrine
Applicant_Challenge: Plaintiffs' inability to demonstrate personal involvement or intent by Mr. Kichuk
Legal_Rule_Source: Case law on personal liability in trademark infringement
Defendant_Response: Mr. Kichuk acted without knowledge and conducted due diligence
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (trademark search), conduct after notice
Remedy_Requested: Injunctive relief and damages (implied from cease and desist)
Legal_Provision: Implied under trademark law and principles of corporate liability
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of evidence supporting personal liability
Jurisdiction: Implied: Federal or state court with IP jurisdiction
Governing_Rule: Personal liability requires deliberate, willful, and knowing conduct or indifference to infringement risk
